Description: Limestone plaque with Greek alphabetic inscription; illiterate metrical epitaph in four lines commemorating Herakleitos son of Attalos, a Macedonian. A single letter, possibly a 'delta' or uncertain meaning is preserved in the middle of the line below
Curator's comments: No information is supplied about the findspot of the stone, though its origin in a Cairo dealer's shop and its date both suggest it was found in Egypt. For the text, see Fraser and Maas 1955, 117-18 no. III and Bernand 1969, no. 12. On the names of Mecedonians recorded outside their home region, see Tataki 1998, p. 275 no. 328. Bibliography: Bernand, E. 1969, Inscriptions métriques de l'Égypte gréco-romaine. Recherches sur la poésie épigrammatique des Grecs en Égypte. Annales littéraires de l'Université de Besançon 98. Fraser, P.M. and Maas, P. 1955, 'Three Hellenistic epigrams from Egypt', Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 41, 115-18. Tataki, A. B. 1998, Macedonians abroad: A contribution to the prosopography of ancient Macedonia. Meletimata 26 (Athens: Research Centre for Greek and Roman Antiquity).
